actor_awards.notes: Dubbed 'The World's Greatest Entertainer', Jolson was a seminal figure in 20th-century entertainment and the star of the first talking picture, 'The Jazz Singer'. He has three stars on the Hollywood Walk of Fame for Motion Pictures, Radio, and Recording.

filmography.title: The Jazz Singer
filmography.role_description: The son of a Jewish Cantor who defies his father's religious traditions to pursue a career as a jazz singer. This film marked the end of the silent film era.
filmography.plot: The son of a Jewish Cantor must defy the traditions of his religious father in order to pursue his dream of becoming a jazz singer.

filmography.title: The Singing Fool
filmography.role_description: A singing waiter who achieves stardom but suffers personal tragedy, famously performing 'Sonny Boy'.
filmography.plot: A singing waiter strikes it rich and becomes a star, but his success is tempered by a failing marriage and the loss of his beloved son.

filmography.title: Hallelujah I'm a Bum
filmography.role_description: The carefree 'mayor' of a group of hobos in Central Park who falls in love with an amnesiac woman.
filmography.plot: A popular hobo and the Mayor of New York both fall for the same girl, who has lost her memory after a suicide attempt.

filmography.title: Wonder Bar
filmography.role_description: The charismatic owner and master of ceremonies of a Parisian nightclub who navigates the dramas of his patrons and performers.
filmography.plot: The owner of a Parisian nightclub loves his dance partner, who loves the bandleader, who is using her.

filmography.title: Go Into Your Dance
filmography.role_description: A Broadway star with a gambling problem who tries to open his own club with the help of a dancer. The only film co-starring his wife Ruby Keeler.
filmography.plot: An irresponsible Broadway star is barred from show business, so his sister and a dancer help him open a nightclub.

filmography.title: The Singing Kid
filmography.role_description: A successful singer who loses his voice and money, retreating to the country to find himself.
filmography.plot: A Broadway star loses his voice and his fortune, retreating to the country where he finds new inspiration.

filmography.title: Mammy
filmography.role_description: A minstrel show performer who is accused of shooting his friend during a game of craps.
filmography.plot: A performer in a traveling minstrel show courts a girl whose father dislikes show people, while getting mixed up in a shooting.

filmography.title: Big Boy
filmography.role_description: A loyal stable boy and jockey who uncovers a plot to throw the Kentucky Derby.
filmography.plot: A black stable boy (played by Jolson in blackface) becomes a jockey and rides a horse named Big Boy to victory in the Derby.

filmography.title: Say It with Songs
filmography.role_description: A radio singer and songwriter whose gambling habits lead to prison and separation from his son.
filmography.plot: A radio singer kills a man in a fight and is sent to prison, where he writes songs and longs for his son.

filmography.title: Rose of Washington Square
filmography.role_description: A loyal friend and singer who supports a Follies star through her troubled marriage to a con man.
filmography.plot: A singer falls in love with a con artist and stands by him through his troubles, paralleling the real life of Fanny Brice.

filmography.title: Swanee River
filmography.role_description: The leader of the famous Christy Minstrels who popularizes the songs of Stephen Foster.
filmography.plot: A biopic of songwriter Stephen Foster, detailing his unhappy marriage and his struggle for recognition.

filmography.title: Rhapsody in Blue
filmography.role_description: Jolson plays himself in this biopic, performing 'Swanee', the song that Gershwin wrote and Jolson made famous.
filmography.plot: A biographical film about the life and career of American composer George Gershwin.

filmography.title: Hollywood Cavalcade
filmography.role_description: Jolson appears as himself, re-enacting the filming of 'The Jazz Singer' in this meta-movie about Hollywood history.
filmography.plot: A director discovers a young actress and makes her a star in the silent era, but struggles when sound pictures arrive.

filmography.title: A Plantation Act
filmography.role_description: In this early Vitaphone short, Jolson performs three songs in blackface, predating 'The Jazz Singer'.
filmography.plot: A musical short subject featuring Al Jolson performing 'April Showers', 'Rock-a-Bye Your Baby with a Dixie Melody', and 'When the Red, Red Robin'.

filmography.title: Show Girl in Hollywood
filmography.role_description: An uncredited cameo appearance as himself, chatting with the main characters at a premiere.
filmography.plot: A Broadway understudy goes to Hollywood to find fame and fortune but discovers the realities of the movie business.
